title: Commissioning rates

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The number of cadets commissioned in each of the Services further broken down by race, gender, ethnic background and NCAA athletes VS non-NCAA athletes for the past 10 years to the current academic year.  If this information to the requested level of detail is available for download on the VMI or other website I am willing to accept those links and download them myself.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: National Guard Cadets

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records of the number of National Guard Cadets by class, by gender, by race/ethnic background as defined in § 23.1-2507 enrolled in VMI, number graduated, the financial assistance to such Virginia National Guard scholarship cadets for tuition, mandatory fees, and other necessary charges entirely from federal funds, Virginia National Guard funds, or private gifts. provided, and in what capacity they served their two year obligation after graduation for the past 10 academic years including those currently enrolled in academic year 2024 – 2025. If there were no National Guard in the past 10 years or are currently enrolled, please provide this information for the last 3 years any State Cadets were enrolled at VMI. If this program is no longer active at VMI provide the last year VMI enrolled a State cadet and the records showing why the program stopped, who approved its termination, when, and for what reason including any decision documents, recommendations, etc. Any personally identifying information (PII) or FERPA information identifying the individual can be redacted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Anonymous.

title: Assignments/Shifts for Durham PD and HEART personnel (Durham Police Department)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the North Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records detailing assignments and shifts for 911 dispatchers, Durham Police Department personnel, and HEART staff (including social workers, EMTs, and other relevant personnel on CCD, CRT, and COR teams).

Specifically, I request the following information for the period of January 1, 2021 to most recent date data is captured:

911 Dispatch/Emergency Communications Personnel
For each dispatcher on duty:

Identifying Information:
First, middle, and last name
Date of birth
Appointment date
Race and gender
Rank if appropriate

Shift Assignments:
Dates, start and end times of each shift

--

Police Department Personnel
For each officer on duty:

Identifying Information:
First, middle, and last name
Date of birth
Appointment date
Race and gender
Rank

Shift Assignments:
Dates, start and end times of each shift
Assigned beat or district

Activity Details:
Locations or areas of deployment
Any records related to their interactions with the HEART program

--

HEART Program Personnel
For HEART personnel (including social workers, EMTs, and other relevant personnel on CCD, CRT, and COR teams):

Identifying Information:
First, middle, and last name
Whether personnel were part of a specific response team (e.g., Co-Response Team (COR), Crisis Response Team (CRT))
Role (e.g., social worker, EMT, etc.)

Shift Assignments:
Dates, start and end times of each shift
Assigned beat or district

Activity Details:
Logs or records indicating which calls they were assigned to

--

If you determine that portions of the requested records are exempt from disclosure, I ask that you release any segregable portions of the records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

bocar ba

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

title: Lake Washington School District - Building Access Control Systems and logs - L.E. Scarr Resource Center - 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Lake Washington School District - Building Access Control Systems and logs - L.E. Scarr Resource Center - 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052
communications.communication:
January 06, 2025 

via email to PublicRecordsRequest@lwsd.org

Lake Washington School District - Building Access Control Systems and logs - L.E. Scarr Resource Center - 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUEST RCW 42.56

To whom it may concern,

I request the following identifiable public records to be produced in the following order of production:

1. An electronic copy of all records and writings regarding the specifications, installation, operation, and purchase of any and all Building Access Control System(s) for the Lake Washington School District Administrative Offices located in the L.E. Scarr Resource Center at 16250 NE 74th St, Redmond, WA 98052.

Responsive records include but are not limited to:

Key card access system(s)
Video surveillance system(s)
Electronic and Written access logs

Please provide electronic copies of all purchase records, instruction manuals, and system specifications of all Building Access Control Systems and devices in use at the L.E. Scarr Resource Center.

Please provide complete records of all electronic key cards and the name and contact information of each person assigned each specific key card.

Please provide electronic copies of all recorded video surveillance from building cameras installed in the L.E. Scarr Resource Center for the time period June 1, 2024 to January 5, 2025.

Please provide electronic copies of all building access logs and any audits of building access for the time period June 1, 2024 to January 5, 2025.

Please provide any and all incident reports or investigations into any unauthorized building access at the L.E. Scarr Resource Center for the time period January 1, 2020 to January 5, 2025.

Please provide the name and contact information of all personnel authorized to access any Building Access Control Systems and devices in use at the L.E. Scarr Resource Center.

DEFINITION OF RECORDS AND WRITINGS

RECORDS AND WRITINGS as defined by RCW 42.56.010(4): any handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

PRODUCTION PROCESSING AND DELIVERY OF ELECTRONIC RECORDS

Please provide all records in their native electronic format. Please do not instead create new records by printing electronic files then scanning and printing the newly scanned prints.

Washington State Law is clear that the use of 3rd party “portals” (Such as GOVQA) for a public records request is optional for the requestor. Respectfully I decline. Please provide all records electronically via direct email attachment to this email address.

Please do not register this requestor for, nor direct this requestor to the use of any 3rd party commercial portal including but not limited to FOIAOnline, GovQA, NextRequest, FOIAExpress, JustFOIA FOIADirect, WebForm, or any other online service other than a direct NO PASSWORD REQUIRED, NO REGISTRATION REQUIRED, internet cloud-based download link, or electronic email.

Do not send any portion of this public records request to any 3rd party for-profit corporation such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

Do not register this request with any for profit portal or 3rd party organization such as GOVQA, a Grannicus Corporation, NEXT-REQUEST, or JUST FOIA.

PUBLIC RECORDS REQUESTS SUBMITTED VIA EMAIL

RCW 42.56.080 - Identifiable records—Facilities for copying—Availability of public records.

"...Agencies shall honor requests received in person during an agency's normal office hours, or by mail or email, for identifiable public records unless exempted by provisions of this chapter. No official format is required for making a records request; however, agencies may recommend that requestors submit requests using an agency provided form or web page."

This public records request is being made via email. This public records request will be honored and fulfilled by your agency via email as requested or relief will be sought per statute.

NATIVE ELECTRONIC FORMAT

Please provide all identified public records in their NATIVE electronic format, either .pst file or .pdf PORTFOLIO file. Please provide all electronic records in the fewest number of individual files as per native format or use free .zip compression in each installment.

FEES

In the event that there are fees, please inform us of the total charges in advance of fulfilling the request in strict compliance with all provisions of the Washington State Public Records Act.

EXEMPTION LOGS

Please ensure all redactions or exemptions claimed by your agency in the production of responsive records are accompanied by a complete and detailed contemporaneous exemption log noting the valid legal reason for each exemption at each redaction location in the record produced, as well as the specific number of pages if any that your agency redacts or withholds in their entirety. Each redaction should be noted by footnote or by a clear reference to the specific justification for that redaction, and only the minimal exempt portion of any record may be withheld.

COMMERCIAL PURPOSE DECLARATION

The Washington State Public Records Act prohibits the disclosure of “lists of individuals” for a commercial purpose (RCW 42.56.070(8)). I declare this public records request is not being made for any commercial purpose whatsoever. Also, this public records request is not being made for a "list of individuals." This declaration satisfies all requirements of RCW 42.56 regarding prohibitions on lists and commercial purposes. No additional commercial purpose declaration will be completed for this public records request.

PRESERVATION OF PUBLIC RECORDS *** ANTICIPATE LITIGATION ***

WAC 44-14-03005 RETENTION OF PUBLIC RECORDS

The lawful destruction of public records is governed by retention schedules. The unlawful destruction of public records can be a crime. RCW 40.16.010 and 40.16.020. An agency is prohibited from destroying a public record, even if it is about to be lawfully destroyed under a retention schedule, if a public records request has been made for that record. RCW 42.56.100. Additional retention requirements might apply if the records may be relevant to actual or anticipated litigation. The agency is required to retain the record until the record request has been resolved.

Note: An agency can be found to violate the Public Records Act and be subject to the attorneys' fees and penalty provision if it prematurely destroys a requested record after a request is made. See Yacobellis v. City of Bellingham, 55 Wn. App. 706, 780 P.2d 272 (1989). However, it is not a violation of the Public Records Act if a record is destroyed prior to an agency's receipt of a public records request for that record. Bldg. Indus. Ass'n of Wash. v. McCarthy, 152 Wn. App. 720, 218 P.3d 196 (2009); West v. Dep't of Nat. Res., 163 Wn. App. 238, 258 P.3d 78 (2011). The Public Records Act (chapter 42.56 RCW) and the records retention statutes (chapter 40.14 RCW) are two different laws.

COMMUNICATION VIA EMAIL

Please send all requests for clarification, status updates, and production of responsive electronic documents via direct email reply.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. We look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Good Luck.

title: Citadel Uniform Costs

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. Records showing the standard issue of all uniforms to individual Cadets at The Citadel (e.g. Cotee, Blouse, white and or greay pants, class uniforms, etc.) for the past two academic years including the current academic year.
2. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the purchase of each uniform item for cadets (by item and total) over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
3. Records showing the current number of each uniform item issues to cadets and remaining in stock available for issue to Cadets over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
4. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of each type of uniform item for cadets over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
5. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of maintenance of uniform item for cadets over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
6. Records showing the number and type of different uniforms issued to the football and basketbal teams for the past two academic years including the current academic year and, if any of these uniforms were not re-used by subsequent players their disposition (discarded, given to players, etc.)
7. Records showing the source of funds used to purchase uniforms issued to the football and basketbal teams for the past two academic years including the current academic year.
8. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the purchase of each uniform items for the football and basketball teams (by item and total) over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
9. Records showing the current number of each uniform item issued to the football and basketball teams and remaining in stock available for issue over the past two academic years including the current academic year.
10. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of each type of uniform item for the football and basketball teams over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
11. Records, including contracts, payment disbursements, etc. showing the cost of cleaning of maintenance of uniform item for the football and basketball teams over the past two academic years including the current academic year. Please exclude any costs for personal clothing.
12. If Cadets receive their uniforms on a "rental" basis instead of purchasing them, please provide the records of any cost benefit analysis or study conducted that resulted in the rent vs purchase decision.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

title: Citadel Cadet Activity Fees

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the South Carolina Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Records showing what specifically is included in the “Cadet Activity Fee” cadets are chared as part of their tuition under other fees as well as the financial records showing ledger itemized income and expenditures for Cadet Activity fees for the 2008 – 2009, 2009 – 2010, 2020 – 2021, 2021 – 2022, 2022 – 2023, 2023 – 2024 and 2024 – 2025 academic years including how this fee per cadet was determine, who approved the fee, all income to this fund by source, and all expenditures for these funds to the line-item level by student or other activity. For 2024 – 2025 include what is programmed, allocated and committed to date. Itemized expenditures are requested for the amount allocated and line-item expenditures to each club and student organization and what was budgeted for each for the selected academic years what will enable analysis of allocated to expended and within expenditures identify what products or services were procured. These should include the portion of these fees allocated for cadet activities consisting of facilities maintenance, debt service, cadet counseling services, cadet organizations and any other expenditures from this fund by office or organization that expended the funds, by supply or service purchased. Itemized expenditures by category and organization should total the amount reported as collected from Cadets and other identified sources. This information should be readily available in any reasonable standard accounting system using acceptable accounting practices and so should not require a significant level of efforts to identify and provide those records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 15 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anonymous

title: Lab Fees and Tuition Dollars

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Lab Fees and Tuition Dollars
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

1) Financial records maintained by the College delineating total fees collected from students classified as “Lab Fees” for the following fiscal years: FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024. Please include a breakdown of lab fees by academic department/unit of the College.

2) Financial records maintained by the College outlining expenses paid by lab fees monies for the following fiscal years: FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024. Please include a breakdown of the expenses funded by "Lab Fees" monies by academic department/unit of the College.

3) Financial records maintained by the College delineating tuition dollars collected for the following fiscal years: FY2022, FY2023, and FY2024. Please breakdown the tuition by student’s declared degree program for the following programs: 
-Associate of Applied Science in Maritime Technology and Operations 
-Bachelor of Engineering in Electrical Engineering, Facilities Engineering, Marine Engineering, Mechanical Engineering, Naval Architecture 
-Bachelor of Science in International Transportation and Trade, Marine Environmental Science, Maritime Studies, Marine Operations, Marine Transportation, Data Science and Machine Learning
-Master of Science in Shipping and Logistics, Maritime and Naval Studies 

4) For each record identified in the requests above, please provide an explanation of all abbreviations or acronyms in the records.

To the extent that records are available in electronic format ideally in either an electronic spreadsheet or comma-separated format (Excel or CSV). 

If any records are unavailable within five business days of receipt of the request, and responsive records exist, I seek a description of such records and a timeline of when access to the records will be provided. If you determine that certain parts of this request may be more easily produced than others, please provide records on a rolling basis.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

A. Eric Pasillas

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Information Requested:

Please produce any and all records related to the DOJ OIG documenting 'attacks' on the DOJ OIG website assigning an 'Attack ID#'s and Message ID#' to each website attack.

title: Reports regarding display of U.S. flag and recitation of Pledge of Allegiance

communications.subject: Oklahoma Open Records Act Request: Reports regarding display of U.S. flag and recitation of Pledge of Allegiance
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oklahoma Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Each "report detailing [a district's] policies regarding the display of the U.S. flag and the weekly recitation of the Pledge of Allegiance," including the "specific measures the district has implemented to ensure compliance and how these practices are being integrated into the school culture," as required by the August 29, 2024, press release from Ryan Walter, State Superintendent of Public Instruction, concerning "Guidelines of Patriotic Displays."

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh
